newsitem.title: USA: Mazel sees Q1 results disappointing Street.
newsitem.headline: Mazel sees Q1 results disappointing Street.

text.p: Mazel Stores Inc said Monday it expects to earn about $0.17 a share in the first fiscal quarter, or about 30 percent below Wall Street estimates.
The discount retailer earned $0.23 a share on a pro forma basis for the same period last year. It went public last November at $16 a share.
According to First Call, analysts expect the company to earn $0.24 a share for the quarter.

Mazel held a telephone conference call with investors and analysts on Friday at 1630 EDT/2030 GMT. Before trading in its stock was halted Friday afternoon by Nasdaq, the shares fell 6-5/8, or 34 percent, to 12-5/8 as Wall Street got word that a conference call would be held.
Mazel said it plans to announce its first quarter results during the last week of May.
Despite the disappointing quarterly earnings, Mazel Chairman and Chief Executive Reuven Dessler said he still feels "comfortable" with analysts' estimates for the full year.
According to First Call, the company is expected to earn $1.08 a share for the year.
Mazel said sales for the first quarter should rise about 25 percent from a year earlier, but same-store sales will fall four to five percent.

Comparable store sales are based on 13 stores. The 10 stores opened in fiscal 1996 "have siphoned and are expected to continue to siphon sales from the 13 mature stores located in the same market," the company said.

It also cited lower shipments to the stores in the early portion of the quarter, the timing of a large purchase during the quarter, and the later timing of Passover, which hurt sales in its New York and New Jersey markets.
Mazel said wholesale sales to third parties for the first quarter fell 14 percent from last year.
